snippet: The insurgents’ seizure of areas near the airport comes as the United Nations and the Arab League announce that Lakhdar Brahimi, a veteran diplomat, will succeed Kofi Annan as the envoy to Syria.
abstract: Syrian insurgents in Aleppo seize areas near its airport, threatening government's control of a strategically vital supply conduit and scoring a propaganda victory in protracted battle in Syria's largest metropolis; Aleppo fighting, as well as heavy clashes in Damascus area, come as United Nations and the Arab League appoint Lakhdar Brahimi to succeed Kofi Annan as special envoy to Syria.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and HWAIDA SAAD
byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone reported from New York, and Hwaida Saad from Antakya, Turkey.

lead_paragraph: The insurgents’ seizure of areas near the airport comes as the United Nations and the Arab League announce that Lakhdar Brahimi, a veteran diplomat, will succeed Kofi Annan as the envoy to Syria.

headline.seo: Syria Rebels Threaten Aleppo Airport, and an Envoy Is Chosen
headline.main: Syrian Rebel Forces Advance Close to the Airport at Aleppo
headline.print_headline: Syrian Rebel Forces Advance Close to the Airport at Aleppo

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
